intro: Chrysochosma galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos goldenstar, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its yellow star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of the islands. Its leaves are palmate, with multiple lobes, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Chrysochosma galapagensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
